intro: Grosourdya monsooniae, commonly known as the monsoonal grosourdia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Grosourdya monsooniae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and parks.
